consumerDisclosures.title: Consumer Disclosures
consumerDisclosures.description: In compliance with federal regulations, Mystros Barber Academy provides the following consumer information to prospective and enrolled students.

sections.title: Accreditation
sections.content: Mystros Barber Academy is accredited by the Council on Occupational Education (COE). COE is recognized by the U.S. Department of Education as a national accrediting agency.

sections.title: State Licensing
sections.content: Mystros Barber Academy is licensed by the Texas Department of Licensing and Regulation (TDLR) to operate as a barber school in the State of Texas.

sections.title: Financial Aid Information
sections.content: Mystros Barber Academy participates in Title IV federal financial aid programs. Our FAFSA school code is 042609.

sections.title: Completion & Graduation Rates
sections.content: The following rates are based on the most recent cohort data available.

sections.title: Job Placement Rates
sections.content: Mystros Barber Academy maintains strong relationships with barbershops and salons throughout the Houston metropolitan area.

sections.title: Cost of Attendance
sections.content: Total program costs including tuition, fees, books, and supplies.

sections.title: Refund Policy
sections.content: Mystros Barber Academy maintains a refund policy in accordance with federal, state, and accreditation requirements. Please refer to the enrollment agreement for complete details.
summary: Full refund if student withdraws before classes begin
Pro-rata refund based on hours completed during first 60% of program
No refund after completing more than 60% of program hours

sections.title: Privacy Rights (FERPA)
sections.content: The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) affords students certain rights with respect to their education records.
rights: The right to inspect and review education records
The right to request amendment of records
The right to consent to disclosures of personally identifiable information
The right to file a complaint with the U.S. Department of Education

sections.title: Satisfactory Academic Progress (SAP)
sections.content: Students must maintain satisfactory academic progress to remain eligible for financial aid.
requirements: Complete program within 150% of normal timeframe

sections.title: Drug-Free Campus Policy
sections.content: Mystros Barber Academy maintains a drug-free campus in compliance with the Drug-Free Schools and Communities Act.

sections.title: Voter Registration
sections.content: Students are encouraged to register to vote. Voter registration forms are available at both campus locations.

sections.title: Constitution Day
sections.content: Mystros Barber Academy observes Constitution Day annually on September 17th with educational activities.

sections.title: Student Complaint Procedure
sections.content: Students with complaints should first attempt to resolve issues with instructors or campus administration. Unresolved complaints may be directed to:
